0.title: Creating Your Account
0.content: Follow these steps to create your Grand Prix account. | Visit grand-prix.eetiming.net | Click “Register” in the top navigation | Fill out the required information | Verify your email address | . Note: . | An email address is required, however if you would like to use the same email address as another user, you can create a sub-account. | .

2.title: Adding Results
2.content: Follow these steps to add results to your Grand Prix account. | Login to your account | Click Add Results | Select the race for which you want to add results | Select the point value you want to add | Click Submit | .

4.title: Deleting Results
4.content: Follow these steps to delete results from your Grand Prix account. | Login to your account | Click My Results | Click the Edit button next to the result you want to edit | Click Delete This Result | . Note: . | After deleting a results for a particular race, you can add a new result again for the same race if needed. | .

6.title: Editing Results
6.content: Follow these steps to edit results in your Grand Prix account. | Login to your account | Click My Results | Click the Edit button next to the result you want to edit | Select a new point value | Click Update | .

8.title: Getting Started
8.content: Learn the basics of using the Grand Prix Results Management System.

9.title: Overview
9.content: The Grand Prix Racing Management System is designed to handle results entry and standings calculation, in real-time. This section will guide you through the essential steps to get started.

10.title: Sub-Accounts
10.content: A sub-account is a separate user account that is linked to your main account (the one you're currently logged in to). Once you create a sub-account, the user of that account can log in on its own and enter/edit results and profile information. After creating a sub-account, you will need to share the password with the sub-account user. The sub-account user can use that password to login and create a new one if desired. You, as the "parent" account, can see the results and profile information for all sub-accounts you create, and can create and edit results on their behalf. Sub-accounts, however, cannot see or access the parent account or other sub-accounts under the parent account. Sub-accounts can have the same email address as the parent account, or a unique one, but an email address is required. If a sub-account has the same email address as the parent account, both the parent and sub-account user will use that email address to log in, and will be presented with a menu to choose what account they want to log into.
